intro: Quercus protoroburoides, commonly known as the Mongolian oak, is a deciduous tree native to central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its lobed leaves and produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in forested areas and is adapted to temperate climates. The botanical features of Quercus protoroburoides make it a significant component of its native ecosystems.
